description.raw:
It turns out that it's not very safe to assume that most of our dependencies will provide pkg-config (.pc) meta-data. Therefore, this PR modifies the default behavior of `ign_find_package(~)` so that it doesn't make any assumptions about how to fill in the pkg-config entry of a package. Instead, it will rely entirely on the find-modules and/or the caller of `ign_find_package(~)` to provide the necessary information, and it will emit an "author warning" if that information is not provided. In cases where we knowingly do not want to include pkg-config information for a dependency, we can explicitly suppress this using `PKCONFIG_IGNORE`.

This does not negatively impact any projects that are currently using `ign-cmake`, but it will help `ign-common` to fill in its pkg-config information correctly.
